questions.q: Which of the following breast lesion is associated with trauma and lactation
questions.explanation: Inflammatory disease of the breast (mastitis) can be acute or chronic, acute mastitis is associated with lactation and cracks in the nipple during lactation, trauma and septicemia. It’s mostly due to bacterial infection. Chronic mastitis is associated with Tuberculosis, fungal infection and parasitic infection.

questions.q: Which is incorrect regarding fat necrosis
questions.C: Hard and irregular mass attached to the skin
questions.explanation: Traumatic fat necrosis is common in fat women though not limited to them. Trauma can be subtle e.g tight bra

questions.q: The following are risk factors of breast cancer
questions.explanation: Nulliparity is a risk factor of breast cancer not multiparity. Breast feeding decreases the risk of breast cancer

questions.q: Which of the following is incorrect about fibroadenoma
questions.A: Lobular and stromal components in variable proportion
questions.B: Most common benign neoplasm of the breast
questions.explanation: Peak age 21-25 years of age. It is the most common breast tumor in premenopausal women

questions.q: The following are features of phyllodes
questions.C: Peak age affected are 35-55, also affects postmenopausal women more
questions.D: Present with distended superficial veins and stretched skin often with ulcers
questions.explanation: We see rapid increase in size with phyllodes

questions.q: What is the most common presentation of breast cancer
questions.explanation: Lump is the most common presentation of breast cancer seen in 75% of patients.  The others are also present.

questions.q: Site of metastases of breast cancer include
questions.explanation: Kidneys are not a common site of metastases of breast cancer

questions.q: Which is the most common site of breast cancer metastases
questions.explanation: All the above are common site of metastases but BONE is the most common site

questions.q: The following are mode of spread of breast cancer
questions.explanation: All are mode of spread of breast cancer

questions.q: You just diagnosed a patient with medullary carcinoma of the breast. What features will you like to tell her so she can know and understand more about her condition
questions.A: It is not associated with lymphocytes and plasma cells
questions.C: There is decrease incidence in BRCA-1 carriers
questions.explanation: Medullary carcinoma has a good prognosis and we see increase incidence in BRCA-1 carriers, also associated with lymphocytes and plasma cells

questions.q: What is the most common form of breast cancer
questions.explanation: Invasive ductal carcinoma makes up 70% or more of breast cancers

questions.q: The following are features of ductal carcinoma in situ
questions.D: Can be solid, cribriform, papillary or micro papillary
questions.explanation: Ductal carcinoma in situ doesn’t breech the basement membrane

questions.q: The following are clinical presentations of breast cancer
questions.explanation: Nipple discharge, painless mass, bloody nipple discharge, lymphedema are all clinical presentations of breast cancer

questions.q: The following are part of triple assessment in the investigation of breast cancer
questions.explanation: The triple assessment comprises of Radiology/imaging, cytology/histology and clinical breast examination.

questions.q: The following are indications for mastectomy
questions.explanation: Local recurrence, patient preference, large tumors, central tumors beneath or involving the nipple are all indications for mastectomy

questions.q: The most common cause of congenital hypothyroidism is
questions.explanation: Thyroid dysgenesis is the most common cause of congenital hypothyroidism

questions.q: The following drugs can lead to hypothyroidism except
questions.explanation: Ciprofloxacin does not cause hypothyroidism

questions.q: A 29 year old lady present to your clinic with complaints of fatigue and weight gain. On physical examination you notice she has dry coarse hair. What is the most likely cause of these patients  presentations
questions.explanation: This patient has the classical clinical presentations of hypothyroidism. Dry hair and skin, cold intolerance, mennorhagia, constipation, fatigue and weight gain are all clinical presentations of hypothyroidism.

questions.q: What is the drug of choice in the management of the previous or above patient
questions.explanation: Levothyroxine is converted to active hormone T3 and is the drug of choice in the treatment of hypothyroidism

questions.q: Which of the following is the most common cause of hyperthyroidism
questions.explanation: Graves disease is the most common cause of hyperthyroidism and its an autoimmune disease

questions.q: These are all features of hyperthyroidism
questions.A: Weight loss despite normal or increased appetite
questions.explanation: Hyperthyroidism presents with sinus tachycardia not sinus bradycardia

questions.q: what is the definite therapy for simple multi nodular goiter
questions.explanation: Surgery is the definite treatment option for simple multi nodular goiter and levothyroxine for diffuse hyperplastic goiter

questions.q: indications for thyroid surgery includes
questions.explanation: Neoplasm, bleeding, pressure symptoms, retrosternal extension, recurrent cysts, patients wishes and failure of medical management are all indications of thyroid surgery

questions.q: The following can lead to hypothyroidism
questions.explanation: Graves disease causes hyperthyroidism not hypothyroidism

questions.q: Complications of thyroid surgery includes
questions.explanation: All are complications of thyroid surgery

questions.q: Which is the most common hernia in females
questions.explanation: Femoral hernia is the most common type of hernia affecting females. In general inguinal hernia is the most common type

questions.q: Hernia can present as
questions.explanation: Hernia can present as reducible, irreducible, obstructed and strangulated

questions.q: What type of hernia presentation predispose to strangulation
questions.explanation: Irreducible hernia predispose to strangulation and also can be diagnostic of omentocele

questions.q: The following are clinical presentations of hernia
questions.explanation: Hernias are extremely tender

questions.q: Risk factors of hernia Include
questions.explanation: Chronic cough, pregnancy, congenital, pregnancy and weight lifting are all risk factors of hernia not cough

questions.q: The following are compositions of hernia
questions.explanation: The components of hernia are the sac, the coverings and the contents

questions.q: Which one is incorrect regarding hernia
questions.A: Strangulated hernia occurs when the blood supply of its content is severely impaired
questions.B: Both direct and indirect hernia are considered to originate from a congenital variant
questions.C: There is an interference of blood supply in obstructed hernia
questions.D: Irreducible hernia is diagnostic of omentocele
questions.explanation: Obstructed hernia is an irreducible hernia containing bowels but there is no interference to the blood supply of the bowel. It culminates in strangulation

questions.q: What type of hernia passes through the inguinal canal and is lateral to the inferior epigastric artery
questions.explanation: Indirect inguinal hernia passes through the inguinal canal and is lateral to the inferior epigastric artery while direct inguinal hernia passes through the hesselbach’s triangle and is medial to inferior epigastric artery

questions.q: The following are complications of herniotomy
questions.explanation: Injury to ilioinguinal nerve, post operative hydrocele, injury to vas deferens, iatrogenic undescended testis and post operational urinary retention are all complications of herniotomy

questions.q: The following are clinical features of appendicitis
questions.C: Right iliac fossa localized peritonitis (may become generalized)
questions.explanation: There is an increase pain on movement with appendicitis

questions.q: The following are signs seen in appendicitis
questions.explanation: Kernigs sign is present in meningitis. Rovsing’s sign, psoas sign and obturator sign are all present in appendicitis

questions.q: Which is not a complication of appendicitis
questions.explanation: Appendiceal abscess, perforation, spreading peritonitis, appendiceal gangrene, appendiceal mass and perforation are all complications of appendicitis

questions.q: One of the following is not an immediate post op complications of appendectomy
questions.explanation: Bleeding, perforation, and abscess are all immediate complications of appendectomy. Adhesion, and occlusion to fallopian tubes leading to infertility are long term complications

questions.q: The peak incidence age for appendicitis
questions.explanation: The peak incidence age for appendicitis is 10-20 years

questions.q: Which of the following is not an intramural cause of obstructive jaundice
questions.B: Parasitic infections such as ascaris lumbricoides and schistosoma japonicum
questions.explanation: Parasitic infections are causes of intraluminal obstructive jaundice not intramural obstructive jaundice

questions.q: All are clinical features of obstructive jaundice
questions.explanation: Pale stool, jaundice, itching, poor wound healing and bleeding are all features of obstructive jaundice

questions.q: Pre operative measures in jaundice patients include
questions.B: Give IM vit. K 10 mg or fresh frozen plasma
questions.explanation: Hydration, nutritional support, antibiotics, prevent hypoglycemia, correct anemia, vit. K, and give oral cholestyramine are all pre op prep for surgery in jaundice patients.

questions.q: Definite treatment of common bile duct stones
questions.explanation: Surgery (cholecystectomy with common bile duct exploration)

questions.q: Principles for the management of patients with obstructive jaundice
questions.C: Rx problems peculiar to jaundice patients
questions.explanation: Resuscitation, investigation, Rx problems peculiar to jaundice patients, provide a channel for draining the biliary tract and treat the underlying cause if possible are the principles of management of obstructive jaundice

questions.q: The second most common cause of cancer death in the west
All are risk factors of colon cancer
questions.explanation: Asbestosis is s risk factor of lung cancer not colorectal cancer. Dietary pattern (increase in animal fat consumption), cigarette smoking, alcoholism, family history of colorectal cancer or any other cancer are all risk factors of developing colorectal cancer

questions.q: The following are clinical presentations of colorectal cancer
What is the peak age for developing colorectal cancer
questions.explanation: The peak incidence for developing colorectal cancer is in 60-70 year olds, both men and women

questions.q: The following are observed on examination of patient with colorectal cancer
questions.explanation: Jaundice is not a clinical presentation of colorectal cancer

questions.q: Which is the tumor marker of colorectal cancer
questions.explanation: Carcinoembryonic antigen is the marker of colorectal cancer, use in monitoring of recurrence and progress. CA 125 is a marker of ovarian cancer, CA 19-9 is a marker of pancreatic cancer and PSA is a marker of prostate cancer
